name: Salted Date Caramel, Chocolate Pie with Almond Coconut Crust. Vegan Glutenfree No Bake
description: This Vegan Salted Caramel Pie has layers of Salted Date Caramel, Chocolate Mousse and Almond Hemp Chocolate Crust. No Bake Gluten-free palm oil free Makes 1 9 inch pie or tart pan

video.name: Salted Date Caramel Chocolate Pie - No Bake | VeganRicha.com
video.description:
Salted Caramel Chocolate Pie! GF
Get this Recipe in my BOOK: http://www.veganricha.com/vegan-richas-everyday-kitchen


This Vegan Salted Caramel Pie has layers of Salted Date Caramel, Chocolate Mousse and Almond Coconut Chocolate Crust. No Bake Gluten-free palm oil free Makes 1 9 inch pie or tart pan.

FULL RECIPE here ➡️ http://www.veganricha.com/2014/06/salted-date-caramel-chocolate-pie-with.html



#vegan #veganism #easyveganrecipes #veganrecipes #veganricha #cooking

Music: Stars at Night by Marc Brigantti.

recipeIngredient: 2 Tbsp hemp seeds (or use coconut flakes)
2 Tbsp flax seed meal  (or chia seeds or coconut flakes)
1.5 Tbsp cocoa powder (omit for less chocolatey pie:))
1 cup soft medjool dates ((approx 11 dates) - soaked in hot water for 15 minutes)
2 Tbsp almond butter  (or other nut butter)
1/2 cup almond milk  (or other non dairy milk)
1/4 tsp fine sea salt (less for less salty caramel)
1 3 oz bar 70% dark Theo chocolate or about 2/3 cup vegan semi sweet chocolate chips

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the dates, for the salted caramel layer in hot water, so they soak for the 15 minutes while you make the crust and topping.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the dates, for the salted caramel layer in hot water, so they soak for the 15 minutes while you make the crust and topping.

itemListElement.text: Process the almonds until coarse meal in a food processor or blender. Add seeds, cocoa, dates, 1/4 cup coconut flakes, salt and pulse until the dates are incorporated well. Add the rest of the coconut flakes, vanilla, maple, almond milk and process until doughy. Add more almond milk or maple if needed and mix a bit your hands. Press the dough onto the pan. You can also make this into bars. Press the dough into a parchment lined 9 by 5 inch or smaller rectangle pan. For variations: Use more almonds or coconut to replace the seeds.
itemListElement.name: Process the almonds until coarse meal in a food processor or blender. Add seeds, cocoa, dates, 1/4 cup coconut flakes, salt and pulse until the dates are incorporated well. Add the rest of the coconut flakes, vanilla, maple, almond milk and process until doughy. Add more almond milk or maple if needed and mix a bit your hands. Press the dough onto the pan. You can also make this into bars. Press the dough into a parchment lined 9 by 5 inch or smaller rectangle pan. For variations: Use more almonds or coconut to replace the seeds.

itemListElement.text: Drain the soaked dates. Puree all the ingredients+soaked dates listed under salted caramel to combine into a smooth puree. blend for a couple of cycles so the dates blend well. Taste and adjust sweet and salt(add maple or stevia if you like it sweeter). Spread on the crust.
itemListElement.name: Drain the soaked dates. Puree all the ingredients+soaked dates listed under salted caramel to combine into a smooth puree. blend for a couple of cycles so the dates blend well. Taste and adjust sweet and salt(add maple or stevia if you like it sweeter). Spread on the crust.

itemListElement.text: Heat coconut milk until it just about starts to bubble and add to a bowl. Add the chocolate and whisk to melt. Briskly whisk in the rest of the ingredients to aerate the mixture. Pour onto the caramel. Tap the pan to spread evenly.
itemListElement.name: Heat coconut milk until it just about starts to bubble and add to a bowl. Add the chocolate and whisk to melt. Briskly whisk in the rest of the ingredients to aerate the mixture. Pour onto the caramel. Tap the pan to spread evenly.

itemListElement.text: Freeze until set (a few hours), then slice and serve! The pie stays soft and well for weeks kept frozen. Cover the pie pan and freeze so that the top layer doesn't dry out.
itemListElement.name: Freeze until set (a few hours), then slice and serve! The pie stays soft and well for weeks kept frozen. Cover the pie pan and freeze so that the top layer doesn't dry out.
